page.title: 01East of Breckland
page.content: The block is at the eastern edge of the Forestry Commission's Thetford Forest. Small wooded areas and tree lined hedgerows are prominent. The land is devoted to agriculture, with grain, rootcrops and some livestock. It is the main source of employment others being with the Forestry Commission and Thetford industry. The population is otherwise scattered. Recent residential development has taken place in East Harling, but its most spectacular and interesting building remains the Church. West Harling church is seldom used. Children attend the Harling Infant and Junior schools, before progressing to Old Buckenham High School at age 11. East Harling Old School Hall is the recreational centre, whislt sporting interest are based on the Recreational Ground.
